name: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - A detailed method statement shall be prepared by the Constructor for the Designer’s review for each piling operation undertaken on the site.
Frequency - 3 weeks prior to the commencement of each piling operation
7.01.02 - Change of piling supervisor, crew of excavation method

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - When a change is made to the piling crew, excavation method or other change (e.g. variations in ground conditions) that could influence the quality of the works, the Designer may adjust the inspection requirement and frequency to suit the revised risk profile of the works.
Frequency - When a change is made
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Non-conformance "make good" measure agreed with Engineer and subsequently completed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - A suitably qualified and experienced person shall be nominated by the Constructor as the ‘Piling Supervisor’.
Frequency - Prior to any piling works commencing.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Designer shall be provided with the proposed concrete mix design for review, prior to any piling works commencing.
Frequency - Prior to any piling works commencing.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Designer inspection of reinforcement cage fabrication process for the first pile at every structure with the Opportunity to inspect (at random for subsequent piles at the same structure)
Frequency - First pile at every structure
4.07.04 - CFA Pile Construction Record Card Template
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Supply a template for the CFA pile construction record card a minimum of 3 weeks prior to the commencement of any piling works.
Verifying Document - Construction Record Card Template
Frequency - 3 weeks prior to the commencement of any piling
DS2672-ITP-S123 - CFA Trial Pile Hold Points - Rev 1
template name: DS2672-ITP-S123 - CFA Trial Pile Hold Points - Rev 1

name: 7.07.01 - Inspection of Reinforcement Cages Prior to Installation
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Designer inspection of the reinforcement cage for the reinforced trial pile.
Verifying Document - Reinforcement Cage Inspection Record
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Designer inspection of concreting for the reinforced and unreinforced trial piles.
Verifying Document - Pile Construction Record Card
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - A set of specimens for concrete tests shall be taken for each trial pile at the following intervals:
b. Reinforced trial pile: 3 days (1no), 7 days (2no), 14 days (2no), 21 days (2no) and 28 days (2no).

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - PIT completed on each pile after the concrete has achieved 75% of it's design strength (75% of 25MPa = 18.75MPa). Preliminary PIT results to be submitted to Designer within 24 hrs of testing being done. Final report to be submitted within 10 days of completion of testing for Designer's review.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Unreinforced pile only to be to be exhumed to a minimum of 3m after PIT testing. To be photographed over the full length exposed and measurement of pile dimensions to be recorded at max. 500mm intervals. Results to be provided to GHD.
DS2672-ITP-S123 - CFA Piling First Pile Hold Points - Rev 1
template name: DS2672-ITP-S123 - CFA Piling First Pile Hold Points - Rev 1

name: 7.07.01 - Inspection of any Reinforcement Cage Extension

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Designer inspection of reinforcement cage extensions for the first pile at every structure with the Opportunity to inspect (at random for subsequent piles at the same structure).
Verifying Document - Reinforcement Cage Inspection Record
Frequency - First pile at every structure with the Opportunity to inspect remainder
7.07.02 - Inspection of Reinforcement Cages Prior to Installation

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Designer inspection of the reinforcement cage for the first pile at every structure with the Opportunity to inspect (at random for subsequent piles at the same structure).
Frequency - First pile at every structure with the Opportunity to inspect remainder
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Designer inspection of concreting for the first pile at every structure with the Opportunity to inspect (at random for subsequent piles at the same structure).
Verifying Document - Pile Construction Record Card
Frequency - First pile at every structure with the Opportunity to inspect remainder

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Designer inspection of the pile head prior to incorporation into the connecting structure for the first pile at every structure with the Opportunity to inspect (at random for subsequent piles at the same structure)
Frequency - First pile at every structure
DS2672-ITP-S123 - CFA Piling Logging Hold Points - Rev 1
template name: DS2672-ITP-S123 - CFA Piling Logging Hold Points - Rev 1

name: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Class 2 – 25% of piles, First 2 No. piles constructed and then at random as advised by the Designer, Geological conditions match ground model and design assumptions. Designer to complete material logging for the first pile for all structures with the Opportunity to complete (at random) for subsequent piles.
Verifying Document - Pile Construction Record Card
Frequency - First 2 No. piles constructed and then 25% at random as advised by the Designer
DS2672-ITP-S123 - CFA Pile Construction Card - Rev 1
template name: DS2672-ITP-S123 - CFA Pile Construction Card - Rev 1

name: 7.02.01 - Nature of Ground and Subsurface Conditions

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Constructor shall inform the Designer where circumstances indicate that ground and / or groundwater conditions differ from those presented in the reports, indicated on the Drawings or interpreted from proof bores.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The logging of selected piles shall also be undertaken by the Designer to agree with the Constructor in identifying the founding stratum.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Digital records from the on board Jean Lutz system containing all information specified in 7.1 of the GHD Specification.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Equipment used for monitoring shall be calibrated at the start of the Works and calibration certificates issued to the Designer prior to commencement. Depth tolerance = +/-50mm; concrete volume = +/-5%
Verifying Document - Calibration certificates, record of depth measurement and concrete volume

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Pile reinforcement cages shall be located centrally within the pile excavation, such that final concrete cover to the extremities of the reinforcement cages is not less than 75 mm at any location.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The delivery docket of each batch delivered certifying the mix designation, cement type, specified strength, slump, date, mixing time, water added during batching and maximum aggregate size.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - A set of specimens for concrete tests shall consist of four specimens from each major pour of concrete, one of which shall be tested at 7 days and the remaining three at 28 days after casting.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Pile heads shall be broken back to achieve A slightly convex profile so that the middle of the pile is nominally 25 mm above the average level at the perimeter of the pile and a Type B construction joint in accordance with standard NZS3109:1997.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - On completion of pile installation and prior to incorporating any piles into the permanent works, the actual pile locations and verticality shall be confirmed by a suitably experienced surveyor.
Frequency - 5 working days prior to incorporating any piles into the permanent works.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Pile construction records shall be submitted to the Designer within 24 hours of completion of any particular pile. Copies of the records shall be retained on site and made available for inspection by the Designer as required.
Verifying Document - Pile Construction Record Card
Frequency - Within 24 hours of completion of any particular pile

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - PIT completed on each pile after the concrete has achieved 75% of it's design strength (75% of 25MPa = 18.75MPa). Preliminary PIT results to be submitted to Designer within 24 hrs of testing being done. Final report to be submitted within 10 days of completion of testing for Designer's review.
Frequency - First 3 No. piles constructed and then 10 % of piles selected by the Designer, following receipt of the construction record cards.
